pr_title: [NETBEANS-4832] Avoid assertion & NPE in fxml code completion

timeline.message: [NETBEANS-4832] Avoid assertion & NPE in fxml code completion

timeline.bodyText:
Not related to this bug, but a few lines below: (elem.getKind() == ElementKind.CLASS || elem.getKind() == ElementKind.INTERFACE) IMHO does not work for ANNOTATION_TYPE and ENUM. Could be worth to fix as
elem.getKind().isClass() || elem.getKind().isInterface ?
timeline.author: sdedic

replies.bodyText:
So you're saying that the if(result==found)continue seems OK.
And that there's an additional issue that could arise in some cases; and you've proposed a fix which can be incorporated with this change.
replies.author: errael

replies.bodyText: Added separate commit for ANNOTATION_TYPE, ENUM, still in this PR.
replies.author: errael

timeline.bodyText: I understand the trigger, but couldn't it be fixed right in the getPackagElement(), @jlahoda ?
timeline.author: sdedic

replies.bodyText: Did you mean getElements() rather than getPackageElement()?
replies.author: errael

replies.bodyText: I think the expected way would be to get a CompilationController (instead of just CompilationInfo) and call toPhase(ELEMENTS_RESOLVED), or alike, on it.
replies.author: jlahoda

replies.bodyText: @jlahoda Use CompilationController as suggested. Works, thanks. Please review.
replies.author: errael

timeline.message: Handle ANNOTATION_TYPE and ENUM in getTypeElementByBinaryName().
Handle ANNOTATION_TYPE and ENUM in getTypeElementByBinaryName().
